abstract.p: Janet M Moriarty letter praises Arthur Holmberg's August 13 article on 'repressed' plays of Don Pedro Calderon de la Barca (S)

block.p: As a former professor of Spanish and a perpetual student of all things Spanish, I am so pleased whenever the talents and accomplishments of the great writers of that Iberian country are acknowledged in the United States. Arthur Holmberg's observations on the ''repressed'' plays of Don Pedro Calderon de la Barca and the comments of the female actors who took part in this year's Almagro festival [''Spain Dusts Off a Master and Finds He's Sexy,'' Aug. 13] prompt me to take another look at 17th-century Golden Age drama to see what I probably missed.
